definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: The teacher asked all the students to have a globe each.
sentences.chinese: 老師要求所有的學生每人都有一個地球儀。

sentences.english: Take a piece of cardboard or stiff paper and hold it out from a globe .
sentences.chinese: 取一張紙板或硬紙片，拿着它移近地球儀。

sentences.english: There is a telephone, a globe and some books on the desk.
sentences.chinese: 桌子上有一個電話，一個地球儀和一些書。

sentences.english: Built-in motor rotates this illuminated Earth at a constant rate.
sentences.chinese: 內置馬達讓這款裝有燈飾的地球儀以恆定速率旋轉。

sentences.english: Bush gave the vice president a $425 floor globe.
sentences.chinese: 而布什則回贈了一個價值425美元的落地式地球儀。

sentences.english: I started looking for globes and mad lab equipment .
sentences.chinese: 我便開始找地球儀和實驗室的設備。

sentences.english: We use a globe in our geography class.
sentences.chinese: 我們在地理課上使用地球儀。

sentences.english: At that time in every classroom of the school there was a big globe.
sentences.chinese: 那時候，學校的每個教室裏都有一個大大的地球儀。

sentences.english: So just imagine you are holding a globe and are looking down at the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 設想一下你正在託着地球儀，俯視太平洋。

sentences.english: The teacher rolled a globe to the front of the room and asked him to point out India.
sentences.chinese: 老師把地球儀推到教室前面，讓他指出印度的位置。
